The video was published on Facebook on D: 2020, and was shared more than 200 times in a Facebook group with over 19,000 members.
The post: s Chinese-language caption translates to English as "Inner Mongolian monster," indicating the location mentioned in the claim.
The video was also shared on multiple Fa: as well as on the official Instagram account of Mojosemi Forest Park, an Indonesian outdoor adventure park.
Honggo Utomo: a representative for Mojosemi Forest Park, confirmed that the video shows a triceratops puppet used as part of their marketing strategy for the Christmas and New Year holidays. He explained that the puppet is controlled by two people inside and supported by a mechanical electronic system to create realistic movements.
